sen.j: 三社参り（さんしゃまいり）とは、三つの神社を詣でることをいう。
sen.e: Sanshamairi is to visit three Shinto shrines.
Sanshamairi is to visit three Shinto shrines.
Sanshamairi is to visit three Shinto shrines.

sen.j: 三社参りは地域に根付いた風習として一般的に行われている地域もある。
sen.e: In some regions sanshamairi is a custom which has taken root and which is generally practiced as such.
In some regions sanshamairi is a custom which has taken root in general.
In some regions sanshamairi is a custom which has taken root in general.

sen.j: 西日本各地の風習「三社参り」
sen.e: A custom called 'Sanshamairi' at various places in the western Japan
A custom called 'Sanshamairi' at various places in western Japan
A custom called 'Sanshamairi' at various places in western Japan

sen.j: 西日本の各地の風習としての三社参りは、正月の初詣として、三つの神社を詣でることを指す。
sen.e: Sanshamairi which is a custom at various places in the western Japan means visits to three Shinto shrines for hatsumode (new year's visit to a shrine) on New Year's Holidays.
Sanshamairi which is a custom at various places in western Japan means visits to three Shinto shrines for hatsumode (new year's visit to a shrine) on New Year's Holidays.
Sanshamairi which is a custom at various places in western Japan means visits to three Shinto shrines for hatsumode (new year's visit to a shrine) on New Year's Holidays.

sen.j: この風習が根付いた地域の人々は、「初詣＝三社参り」であり、特別な信仰心とは無関係に、当然のこととして三社参りを行う。
sen.e: The people who live at the places where this custom has been established make sanshamairi as a matter of course regardless of particular special (religious) piety, considering 'hatsumode = sanshamaairi'.

The people who live at the places where this custom has been established do sanshamairi as a matter of course regardless of particular special (religious) piety, considering 'hatsumode = sanshamairi.'
sen.cmt: make ⇒ do に訂正しました。'sanshamaairi'. ⇒ 'hatsumode = sanshamairi.' に訂正しました。
sen.e: The people who live at the places where this custom has been established do sanshamairi as a matter of course regardless of particular special (religious) piety, considering 'hatsumode = sanshamairi.'

sen.j: 特に福岡県を中心として九州地方・中国地方の一部では強く根付いた風習である。
sen.e: It is a custom which has firmly taken root especially in parts of Kyushu and Chugoku regions centering around Fukuoka Prefecture.
It is a custom which has firmly taken root especially in parts of Kyushu and Chugoku regions centering around Fukuoka Prefecture.
It is a custom which has firmly taken root especially in parts of Kyushu and Chugoku regions centering around Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 三社参りの風習のない人々からすると、初詣で複数の神社に参るというのは少し特異なことであり、「ありがたみが減るのではないか」「あまりよくないのではないか」と否定的に捉える場合もあるようである。
sen.e: Visiting multiple shrines on New Year's Holidays sounds a little peculiar to the people who do no have a custom of sanshamairi and some of them get it negatively saying 'It may reduce appreciation,' and 'It may be not so good.'.

Visiting multiple shrines on New Year's Holidays sounds a little peculiar to the people who do no have a custom of sanshamairi and some of them get it negatively saying 'It may reduce appreciation,' and 'It may be not so good.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドをひとつ削除しました。
sen.e: Visiting multiple shrines on New Year's Holidays sounds a little peculiar to the people who do no have a custom of sanshamairi and some of them get it negatively saying 'It may reduce appreciation,' and 'It may be not so good.'

sen.j: 地域によって「一日のうちに三社詣でなければならない」「三が日の間に詣でなければならない」といった決まりごとが聞かれるが、これといって定まってはいない。
sen.e: In some areas we hear rules such as 'You must visits three shrines within one day.' and 'You must make the visits on the first three days.', but there are no fixed rules.
In some areas we hear rules such as 'You must visit three shrines within one day.' or 'You must make the visits on the first three days in January.', but there are no fixed rules.
sen.cmt: visitsのs を削除しました。and ⇒ or にしました。the first three days in January に訂正しました。
sen.e: In some areas we hear rules such as 'You must visit three shrines within one day.' or 'You must make the visits on the first three days in January.', but there are no fixed rules.

sen.j: 「三社」は具体的にどの三つの神社を詣でるべきか、という問題があるが、これは定番がはっきりと定まっている地域もあれば、まったく定まっておらず好きな三社を詣でる、という地域もある。
sen.e: While some question which shrines are meant by 'sansha' (three shrines), in some areas a fixture is clearly determined and, in other areas it is totally unclear and any three shrines which one like can be visited.

While some question which shrines are meant by 'sansha' (three shrines), in some areas a fixture is clearly determined and, in other areas it is totally unclear and any three shrines you like can be visited.
sen.cmt: which one ⇒ you に訂正しました。
sen.e: While some question which shrines are meant by 'sansha' (three shrines), in some areas a fixture is clearly determined and, in other areas it is totally unclear and any three shrines you like can be visited.

sen.j: しかし、やはり有名な大きな神社が近くにあれば、それを含めるのが普通である。
sen.e: However, if there is a famous large shrine, it is natural to include that shrine.
However, if there is a famous large shrine, it is natural to include that shrine.
However, if there is a famous large shrine, it is natural to include that shrine.

sen.j: 詣でる順番については特に決まりごとは聞かれない。
sen.e: We hear no fixed rule concerning the order of the visits to shrines.
We hear no fixed rule concerning the order of the visits to shrines.
We hear no fixed rule concerning the order of the visits to shrines.

sen.j: 三社参りの由来
sen.e: The origin of sanshamairi
The origin of sanshamairi
The origin of sanshamairi

sen.j: 三社参りの由来については諸説あり、はっきりしていない。
sen.e: There are various theories concerning the origin of sanshamairi, but it is not clear.
There are various theories concerning the origin of sanshamairi, but it is not clear.
There are various theories concerning the origin of sanshamairi, but it is not clear.

sen.j: 元々朝廷が伊勢神宮、石清水八幡宮、賀茂神社の三社に奉幣し、これが庶民にも三社詣でる風習として広まった、という説。
sen.e: One theory says that originally the Chotei (Imperial Court) conducted hohei (offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god) at the three shrines, namely Ise Jingu Shrine, Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine, and Kamo-jinja Shrine, which has spread to the general public as a custom to visit three shrines.

One theory says that originally the Chotei (Imperial Court) conducted hohei (offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god) at the three shrines, namely Ise Jingu Shrine, Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine, and Kamo-jinja Shrine, which has spread to the general public as a custom to visit three shrines.

One theory says that originally the Chotei (Imperial Court) conducted hohei (offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god) at the three shrines, namely Ise Jingu Shrine, Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine, and Kamo-jinja Shrine, which has spread to the general public as a custom to visit three shrines.

sen.j: もともとは先祖代々の守護神である氏神様、出生地の守護神でありその人の一生の守り神である産土神様、現在住んでいる地域の守護神である鎮守神様の三つの神様に挨拶をする意味で三社詣でていた、という説。
sen.e: Another says that it is meant to salute to the three shrines, namely ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) who is an ancestral guardian god, ubusunagami (guardian deity of one's birthplace), who is the guardian god of one's birthplace and the guardian god of one's entire life, and chinju (local Shinto deity) who is the guardian god of the place where one lives.

Another says that it is meant to salute to the three shrines, namely ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) who is an ancestral guardian god, ubusunagami (guardian deity of your birthplace), who is the guardian god of your birthplace and the guardian god of your entire life, and chinju (local Shinto deity) who is the guardian god of the place where you live.
sen.cmt: one's ⇒ your に訂正しました。one lives ⇒ you live に訂正しました。
sen.e: Another says that it is meant to salute to the three shrines, namely ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) who is an ancestral guardian god, ubusunagami (guardian deity of your birthplace), who is the guardian god of your birthplace and the guardian god of your entire life, and chinju (local Shinto deity) who is the guardian god of the place where you live.

sen.j: 三社参りの風習のある地域
sen.e: Regions where the sanshamairi custom exists.
Regions where the sanshamairi custom exist.
sen.cmt: exists ⇒ exist に訂正しました。
sen.e: Regions where the sanshamairi custom exist.

sen.j: 和歌山県

sen.j: 和歌山県の三社参り
sen.e: Sanshamairi in Wakayama Prefecture
Sanshamairi in Wakayama Prefecture
Sanshamairi in Wakayama Prefecture

sen.j: 和歌山県和歌山市にある日前神宮・國懸神宮（ひのくまじんぐう・くにかかすじんぐう）と竈山神社（かまやまじんじゃ）と伊太祁曽神社（いたきそじんじゃ）の三社を詣でる。
sen.e: They visit three shrines, namely Hinokuma-jingu Shrine/Kunikakasu-jingu Shrine, Kamayama-jinja Shrine, and Itakiso-jinja Shrine located in Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture.
They visit three shrines, namely Hinokuma-jingu Shrine/Kunikakasu-jingu Shrine, Kamayama-jinja Shrine, and Itakiso-jinja Shrine located in Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture.
They visit three shrines, namely Hinokuma-jingu Shrine/Kunikakasu-jingu Shrine, Kamayama-jinja Shrine, and Itakiso-jinja Shrine located in Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 古くより三社をお参りする人が多く、この三社を結ぶ形で和歌山電鐵貴志川線が走っている。
sen.e: Many people have been visiting these shrines through the ages, and Kishigawa Line of WAKAYAMA ELECTRIC RAILWAY Co., Ltd. is available connecting these thrines.
Many people have been visiting the three shrines through the ages, and Kishigawa Line of WAKAYAMA ELECTRIC RAILWAY Co., Ltd. is available connecting these shrines.
sen.cmt: these shrines ⇒ the three shrines に訂正しました。 thrines ⇒ shrines に訂正しました。
sen.e: Many people have been visiting the three shrines through the ages, and Kishigawa Line of WAKAYAMA ELECTRIC RAILWAY Co., Ltd. is available connecting these shrines.

sen.j: 日前神宮、國懸神宮、竈山神社は旧官幣大社であり、伊太祁曽神社は旧官幣中社である。
sen.e: Hinokuma-jingu Shrine, Kunikakasu-jingu Shrine, Kamayama-jinja Shrine were formerly designated as Kanpei-taishas (large-scale state shrines), and Itakiso-jinja Shrine a Kanpei Chusha shrine (middle-scale state shrines).

Hinokuma-jingu Shrine, Kunikakasu-jingu Shrine, Kamayama-jinja Shrine were formerly designated as Kanpei-taisha (large-scale state shrines), and Itakiso-jinja Shrine a Kanpei Chusha shrine (middle-scale state shrines).
sen.cmt: taishas の s を削除しました。
sen.e: Hinokuma-jingu Shrine, Kunikakasu-jingu Shrine, Kamayama-jinja Shrine were formerly designated as Kanpei-taisha (large-scale state shrines), and Itakiso-jinja Shrine a Kanpei Chusha shrine (middle-scale state shrines).
